lead_paragraph: SCHULMAN--Jerome L.,M.D., died at home in New York on June 30. He was 89. Dr. Schulman, a pioneering virologist in influenza research, was on the faculty of the Mount Sinai School of Medicine from 1968 until he retired in 2005. He was one of the first to discover the uniqueness of the Hong Kong virus of 1968 by differentiating it from previously prevalent Asian viruses. The Hong Kong strain had killed an estimated one million people worldwide. Surviving is his wife of 56 years, the poet Grace Schulman. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SCHULMAN, JEROME L.
